Reviews.Title: “Stay at Hotel Locanda”
Reviews.Author: Jacques R
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant small hotel ideally located. Appartments are large and comfortable and give you the feeling of living in your own house. The location is excellent between San Marco and Academia, while being perfectly quiet during the night. We can defenitely recommend this address

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: KWSmith59
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay in Venice over Easter week. We stayed at Locanda Art Deco for five nights and had a great experience. We had a room right off the breakfast area and facing the street, but had no concerns with noise from either. The room was comfortable, the shower pressure strong (although the hot water tapered off for the second person in) and the breakfast croissants, bread and cereal with freshly made cappuccino was just what was needed for a relaxing trip. As others have posted, the location is ideal. We were able to walk easily to St Mark's Square, the Rialto, across the Academia bridge and the Peggy Guggenheim museum. Plenty of good restaurants in the area, but the street is not a main thoroughfare, so less noisy. A good spot, even in high season!

Reviews.Title: “A Generous Welcone to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Martin G
Reviews.Content: It was our first tie to Venice. We arrived from Marco Polo (one of the nicest airports) by water taxi in the dark to the deep quiet and dark of the legendary city, which dropped us of at the Ponte Del'Accademia from where it was a short walk through a large square and a narrow street to the hotel. Looking on Google Earth helped to identify our location. The Locanda is a small, warm and welcoming six-bedroomed hotel. After registering, and expecting to be led upstairs, we were escorted outside and round the corner to an old dark door. A little unnerving? Perhaps. We need't have worried. We had been given a free upgrade to a very spacious studio apartment, which is in a seperate building with its own kitchenette and balcony with large sofa-bed, formal chairs, dining table and huge king sized bed on the high mezzanine. having this apartment gave us the freedom to bring food back to make our own lunches/dinners on a few occasions, and just enabled us to relax more. We were very lucky to be given this upgrade because even before Easter we woulod no have been able to afford it normally. Nature also gifted us perfect weather for the entire five days. Breakfast, Italian style, which is croissants, bread, jams and coffee was brough to the room. The apartment is off the square on a narrow residential street in San Marco. Whilst being wonderfully convenient (Piazza San Marco being only a leisurely 15 minutes walk away; the Grand Canal is maybe three minutes away) it also has the advantage of being delightfully quiet, even onto the street (there are 5 apartments in the building, some of which are onto the garden at the rear). All the staff at the hotel are very kind and helpful and we were able to borrow guidebooks. Towels were replaced every day, though we didn't expect it. The only thing we would have liked, being English, would have been a bath, which is available in some apartments/rooms. Even with this minor point, I have no hesitation in awarding the Locanda Art Deco five stars and we will happily go back to this hotel, in this refreshingly civilised city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location; a 10 min walk to Piazza San Marco and a few mins to a vaparetto. We were upgraded to a comfort room free of charge; the room was warm and cosy and a comfortable bathroom. Good value for money for this time of the year in Venice. Breakfast was good and the staff were very helpful and friendly; in particular Linda who always went out of her way to give advice and directions. The room had a computer with free internet which was great! If ever we're in Venice again, would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MihaelaBic
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 nights at this hotel (a long weekend on oct-nov 2011). Very good location. We could visit the city by walking and it is located only 10 mins from San Marco. Good size room, very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: flyingfamily123
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Locanda Art Deco hotel! This was in large thanks to the wonderful staff at the hotel. Nothing was ever to much trouble. Indeed, they often went out of their way to be extra helpful above and beyond what would be required. We were warmly welcomed by Linda and given suggestions of where we might like to visit and eat. This advice proved to be very helpful as we only had three days in Venice and the suggestions helped us make the most of it. The room was spotlessly clean and the woman who bought us our breakfast and cleaned our room (sadly I do not know her name) was lovely. She brought us tea and milk for our fridge so that we could have a hot drink whenever we wanted. The simple breakfasts were also lovely and set us up perfectly for our sightseeing. Fresh croissants, bread, jams and cheese, juice and tea or coffee. The hotel is excellently located for seeing St Mark's Square and is in a beautiful part of Venice (although i doubt there is an ugly part!) We had a wonderful stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it on the staff alone. Grazie mille Locanda Art Deco!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent price for the city”
Reviews.Author: regular-traveller25
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice, without being spectacular; I think we got one of the worst rooms though. The location is good, 8 minute walk to S. Marco, but in a quite area (close to the main canal). The breakfast was quite nice. I think it is an excellent option for the price in Venice (which has some expensive lodging), would definitely come back. Only bad experience was that we arranged transportation to airport with them and it was the same price as the 2 nights of hotel (it was Saturday night though), would recommend arranging outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - mixed service.”
Reviews.Author: Sundance2010
Reviews.Content: We didn't have the best of starts at this hotel. On arrival we were told that "the air conditioning was broken", which meant that we would have to spend the first of 4 nights in the hotel's sister apartments, in the next street, up three flights of stairs, and in a loft room where we couldn't lock the bathroom (so the people in the flat below could have walked in at any moment). We were disappointed at first, particularly when we also saw the breakfast 'room' which consisted of a small landing with about 6 tiny tables - all of which were occupied so we had to stand and wait for a few minutes before a table was vacated. The breakfast itself is very basic, expect a hot drink plus either a croissant or cereal. To be fair to the Locanda Art Deco, there was really no where else to put a breakfast room and they did make the most of the space they have - Venice is not known for its gigantic open spaces, and as most of the buildings are probably protected, installing elevators is practically impossible. We complained - not least because we hadn't even received an apology for the inconvenience and then had to drag our own luggage back to the hotel for the rest of the stay. But they did listen, and after we complained they really made the extra effort to appease us. The hotel room (M1) was lovely, very clean, with traditional beamed sloping ceiling, and a tv and internet access in the room. The bathroom was very clean although the shower leaked but this wasn't a major problem. The staff gave us a mixed service - mostly very helpful and forthcoming with advice about where to go and the best way to get there, but unfortunately there was the occasional 'can't be bothered' approach. If you're in Venice to see the city and are not likely to spend much time in your hotel at all, then this is a great place to stay as the good price makes up for any fall-downs. (P.S. Highly recommend the little tratoria just opposite the hotel if you fancy some good Italian food)

Reviews.Title: “OK - Italy Is Italy, Hotels Are Hotels, But Locanda Art Deco”
Reviews.Author: travelermir
Reviews.Content: Is something else! We usually stay at three star hotels when traveling because they are family run, small and the service is better than the large chain hotels. The hotel and residence is located off the S. Stefano square. We made a last minute decision to take a trip to Venice, Italy. Well, wrong weekend to choose as all the hotels we usually stay at were booked. We also travel with a pet. We found Locanda Art Deco Residencia had one (1) room available. It must have been the last hotel in Venice that had a room and would accept pets. Traveled from the parking garage by ferry to the S. Samuele stop. It was an easy walk from the boat to the hotel. Upon arriving, we entered and the receptionist was busy and like the Italian way, took her time getting to us. That is something you have to get use to in Italy. It is not rude, it is just their way. We were booked and shown to the room which is in another building. The accommodations turned out to be an apartment in the loft which you could say was two stories. The apartment slept two in the loft area upstairs and one in the living area downstairs. And the apartment even had a kitchen area. If you use the kitchen area there is a Euro30 surcharge for cleaning. There was no lift, but the room and facilities were clean. A computer, internet, tv and dvd player are provided. If you rent at the residence part, your breakfast is served in your room between 08:00 AM and 10:00 AM. It is a continental breakfast which you need to order the night before either by stopping in at the hotel itself which is around the corner or by dialing 10. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, helpful and great on making reservations for concerts, excursions, taxi's, dinning, etc. They are knowledgeable and know the good and unusual places. All you need to do is ask. There were several minor points which the hotel needs to address which were brought to their attention and they knew about and are addressing. The safe in the residence is not bolted down or into the wall. So, someone can walk away with your valuables if you use the safe. The furniture needed cleaning. Check out time is 10:00 AM, but you can ask for a later time and if they room is available, they will extend check. If you want the Italian experience, try the Locanda Art Deco hotel or residence. Pets are welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_Griff
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - right on the edge of Campo Santo Stefano, the hotel is located down a small street just off the square. Very straightforward to get to, it is a short walk from 2 water taxi stops - Accademia & St Angelo. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from St Marks Square - however this is dependent on the time of day you decide to walk there, as the narrow streets can become very crowded in the afternoon! It definitely is a boutique hotel! Quite small interior, but has a lovely feel and is very welcoming! The reception area and breakfast area are a bit of a squeeze. In the morning the breakfast area can get very busy, and sometimes you have to wait for a table to become free. Our room was a nice size, however the bathroom was tiny, had to manouver around the door to get to the toliet! Free Wi-Fi access, plus there was a computer in our room to access the internet. The staff were extremely friendly, helpful and spoke very good english. They offered good advice on where to go to eat etc. It was also through their recommendation that we booked our gondolar trip. It was with a lady called Alex (the first gondolier Venice has ever had!) I'm so pleased we booked our trip with her as she was very, very good. We had the gondola to ourselves and were provided with a bottle of Prosecco! If you are planning to book a gondola trip whilst in Venice I can highly recommend Alex - you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, well situated”
Reviews.Author: LesRangersDuRisque
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 2 nights, and we loved it. We booked an economic room, but we were upgraded to a more spacious and comfortable one, which was really enjoyable. The room and bathroom were really clean, and there was air conditioning, which was a really good point in August! A comuter with internet access is available in the room. The hotel is very well situated, 2 minutes from the vaporetto stop and 10 minutes from St Marc plaza. The price is quite correct for Venice. We would definitely come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, furnishings a little shabby (not chic)”
Reviews.Author: OverseasIowan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice. And I love it. That's why I keep returning. Is it for the service (rude reception man or our lost booking causing us to stay in a more expensive room)? Obviously not. But, the location is great, the price is right, and we get breakfast (coffee and brioche) delivered to the apartment. Finding a hotel in Venice can be difficult. They are either terrible locations or high prices. This one is decent. It is close to Campo Santa Margherita (a favorite piazza for Venetians) and it is slightly less touristy than other areas. Just steps from the vaporetto and the Accademia bridge, it takes less than 10 minutes to walk to Piazza San Marco. Two suggestions though: don't ask for restaurant recommendations from the hotel staff, I think they get kickbacks and both restaurant recommendations were duds. Also, it is lovely that you can book a gondola ride from your hotel (rather than dealing with the rude gondoliers on the street), but Alex (the lady gondolier) has very little personality and tends to be less than pleasant. BUT.... if you want a quiet romantic ride, I would recommend it. If you want a guided tour, find a gondolier on a back alley. I will return to this hotel, and I do recommend it to friends and family, just know what you are getting into.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, and a good spot to explore Venice from”
Reviews.Author: magic_curl
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty hotel. Not cheap, but accommodation in Venice usually isn't. No complaints with our room - comfortable bed, no noise, and it even had a basic PC set up for us. Breakfast was provided, which was nice because I am not Italian and I need to eat more than a croissant before lunch. The staff went out of their way to be helpful, arranging a place on the other side of the island where we could store our bags for the evening before catching a night train. Watch out for the sloping roof ceilings on the top floor, and slippery marble staircase.

Reviews.Title: “So Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mgrigsby
Reviews.Content: I could not have been happier with my stay at the Locanda Art Deco! Upon arrival, we discovered our room had been upgraded to the loft apartment at the residencia located nearby and we were thrilled. The loft was spacious and comfortable, with a small terrace and windows overlooking the Campo directly across from the apartment. The staff was friendly and helpful and kind and were always available to help us in any way possible. Paola in particular was wonderful. The breakfast (brought to our room each morning!) was simple but fresh and the coffee was wonderful. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. When I next return to Venice, I will stay at this hotel, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: cmsrosa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our original hotel had a problem and moved us here. Were very pleased with service, Paula and Linda vere very helpful and gave good advise. The rooms were perfectly clean and perfect for us. Breakfast was good, bread, cereal, teas, coffee, jams and croissants. Really well located, we thought it was easy to find but then we did have a GPS with us. All round good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small hotel, great location, helpful staff, comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: lets_go_ME
Reviews.Content: Locanda Art Deco served us very well for our 3 nights in Venice. The triple room (next to the breakfast area) was large enough, comfortable, and clean. Nice furniture, and we loved the beamed ceilings. Out the window, forgettable interior courtyard, but decent light. Staff were helpful, especially Linda. It was nice and quiet. As has been noted, the breakfast "room" is undersized, but this wasn't a big deal for us. We were unable to get an internet connection on their computer, which would have been nice, but wi-fi on my daughter's device worked fine. We liked the posters of musical events and being able to buy tickets at the hotel to an excellent Baroque (mostly) music concert at Chiesa San Vidal right at the other end of Campo San Stefano. We also liked the easy access to the Accademia bridge- since there are only four bridges crossing the Grand Canal, this gave us easy access to the Dorsoduro quarter with some great restaurants and walks. Plus an easy vaporetto stop there. We did have a challenge finding the hotel on arrival, but if I had just printed out the map (which you can get right from Trip Advisor) it would have been dead easy. I would stay here again with no reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: holsarethebest
Reviews.Content: Made welcome by the staff, friendly but not in your face. Booked cheapest rooms in the attic, it is a long way up, the stairs are quite narrow and it would not be suitable for anyone with even minor mobility problems. The slope of the roof made half the room unusable, which was OK, but beware if you are a tall couple the roof on one side of the bed is very low. Small bathroom, everything you could need in it though. Freidly, helpful staff, but in 4 days failed to replace a lightbulb. Wine shop oposite sells local wine for E5 for a litre and a half. Very quiet at night, really comfortable bed. The breakfast room does not have enough tables for the amount of rooms, and while we were there there were several Basil Fawlty moments at breakfast, which amused us, but I'm not sure all the guests felt the same.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: OZTravelers10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very basic but had alot of character. The room was very big and romantic with antique furnishings. The manager was very friendly even though there was a bit of a language barrier. Good Location, although the hotel is easy to miss.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with character and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: amanda_y11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a good location, connected by vaporetto and walkable to the many sites of Venice. Breakfast is decent, and all the staff are friendly and always ready for a chat and to help with advice. The hotel is small, comfortable and has character for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan D
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, its not luxurious or stunning but it captures the essence of Venice. Small rooms and small breakfast area however the breakfasts where very nice and the staff absolutely fabulous. They helped us find our way around Venice without getting lost If I ever go back to Venice I will definitely stay there again. All in all a wonderful experience

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value and friendly”
Reviews.Author: trom9
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is conveniently located in central Venice in a small alley just around the corner of San Stefano Place. Our room was small and clean with a good quality bed. Wifi is included for free. As a special plus it had a very nice old stone floor. This is a lively area with a small wine bar just in the same alley opposite to the hotel. If you go to bed very early and are very sensitive to noise it might not be the ideal place for you. Since we are good sleepers it didn't bother us at all. In contrary, I think a certain amount of noise just belongs to a city. The breakfast place is rather small too and the breakfast is typical Italian, i.e. rather sparse. The staff was very friendly and helpful. All in all we had very pleasant stay and considering the generally high rates in Venice this hotel provides a very good value for its price.

Reviews.Title: “Bad nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: mrsfussypot
Reviews.Content: For a start I was not helped up the stairs with my suitcase - which is a first for a hotel for me - the room was very stuffy as the radiators were on - we had the window open at the front of the hotel and the noise was horrible. Shutters going up and down and the bar opposite making a racket with sweeping and moving stuff around. I don't mind noise at all but it was infuriating. We slept with window open and am now covered in mosquito bites as when it rains in Venice they are out in great force. What can I say about the breakfast - it was terrible - a dried up croissant from a long-life pack, a small roll and some dried biscuits in a packet. the coffee was stewed - we went out for breakdfast instead as there were only a couple of tables at the top of the staircase so not a space to sit. We arrived in the early hours of the morning and could not find the hotel at all - we walked up and down the alleyway before we found it - we were welcomed with - I have been waiting for you -and that he had heard suitcases going up and down - so why did he not come out. I would prefer to stay in a hotel hat has a restaurant and somewhere to sit. The room only had one chair, the TV was tiny and could only get the news channel in English - no plug in the sink - obviously no kettle (and with coffee at Â£6 per cup you would think that is the first thing that would be provided). Cannot see how it is Art Deco either. If I return I would try one of the many other hotels. The bed was very hard and just silly things like the revolting hangers in the wardrobe - a bit of thought is needed at this hotel. Expected a bit more standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: sdbirds
Reviews.Content: We simply loved staying at Art Deco. The staff (Paola and others) were fantastic--- friendly, helpful, and welcoming. Our room was on the 1st floor, and I wish we were higher, but it was roomy, spotlessly clean, and comfortable. The breakfast was simple but delicious (great coffee, steaming hot croissants and rolls every morning) and the location of the hotel was really convenient-- close to the Accademia bridge and vaparetto stop, about a 10 minute walk to St. Mark's Square, and 10 minutes to the Rialto market in the other direction. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marl Dixon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Locanda Art Deco for three nights in September 2010. The hotel was delightful. Extremely good location on a quiet street close to a vaporetto stop and also close to the Academia Bridge. Reasonable sized room and bathroom and a very good breakfast. The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “conveniently located, cozy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: ianroxas
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at Art Deco and enjoyed it. The room was the sort of room you love to come home to after a day of exploring Venice. It is located on a quiet street that's a short walk from a vaporetto stop. It is also near the Accademia bridge. There is a computer in the room that is connected to the internet. Just ask for the bluetooth keyboard from the front desk. I also felt very safe in this location. And there are nearby places to eat, too. Didn't get to try the breakfast, though, because I was always out exploring very early. Breakfast is served at around 8.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and easy to find”
Reviews.Author: Wereonthego
Reviews.Content: Though not bordering a canal, this small hotel is very well placed for sightseeing, dining, strolling, etc. yet it is away from much of the tourist hubbub. Staff was extremely helpful with dining and touring recommendations. The room was as advertised, clean and spacious for a European destination. Ask for a room away from the calle (street) if you are bothered by noise. Our room overlooked the calle so we heard conversation, etc from neighboring restaurants and stores until closing time(midnight). Since we're up late, it didn't bother us but someone who is early to bed might have difficulty. Mornings weren't a problem. The breakfast area is small and therefore crowded and hard to maneuver if a number of guests are eating at the same time. Breakfast offering is typical: cereal, coffee/tea, juice and rolls.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice price.”
Reviews.Author: Blou78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Art Deco for 2 nights and found it very comfortable, clean, convenient and with helpful staff. The hotel has a very quaint and homely feel. The first night we stayed in the Economy Honeymoon suite, on deciding to stay a second night we moved to a cheaper room (by 30 euros) on the 1st floor. Surprisingly this room was better (bigger, brighter with all the same furnishings) The only slight negative with the hotel is that there doesn't seem to be any rooms with a view or a balcony, but for the price, this hotel is a perfect affordable place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, immaculate”
Reviews.Author: tinhtinh
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at Locanda Art Deco on a trip to Venice with my mum. I booked a "surprise" room, it was their cheapest option and you are allocated a room on arrival. We were lucky and got one of the apartments, which usually go by a "sister" name Residenza Art Deco. The loft apartment had a big double bed on the mezzanine and a comfy sofa bed on the main floor. There is a dining table and four chairs as well as a pair of lovely armchairs. It was an immaculate, spacious apartment. Breakfast was served there so we could start the morning by enjoying it by the window looking down to the courtyard. I was thrilled to find this hidden gem. Venice can be pricey but Locanda offered very good value for money without compromising on quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bdepak
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in the last week of July, 2010. 2 rooms for 5 adults and a baby. Location: The selling point is that there is a mini supermaket next door ...and a piazza at the end of the street ..... It is also close to San Samuelle Vaporetti stop. The hotel is 20 minutes by walk from San Marco. Rooms: The hotel and the rooms very 'artistic' in terms of the design and the content in them. Also, the rooms were clean and just right in size (neither big nor small). The prices are reasonable (considering it is Venice !!) and Internet is free as well. The provide a very basic breakfast as well which includes a croissant, some cereal and some coffee. Staff- The lady at the reception (Andrea) was very friendly and helped us with plan each day. Many thanks to her. Good value for money as well. Go for it. If I were to return to Venice, I would have no problems staying in this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: xinffi
Reviews.Content: Triple room was spacious and clean. Hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. Location was central and vaporetto stops were near and easy to find. A minor shortcoming was that there was no fridge or minibar in the room, but we only stayed for one night so this didn't bother much. Breakfast room was very cramped, but since the hotel is small this is acceptable. I've been recommending Locanda Art Deco to friends and family and when I visit Venice again, I will definitely stay there. Hotel staff already welcomed us back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, accommodating and convenient in Venezia”
Reviews.Author: Friendlyjan
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 6 day stay at this hotel. It was great!. The location was convenient and, best of all, accessible from the San Samuele vaporetto stop with no bridges in between. Our room was clean, air conditioned, and quiet. The continental breakfast was pleasant and even included espresso. Even though I made an error in our length of stay, the staff went out of their way to come up with an alternative plan that was to our liking. We got help with museum reservation and also got help with train travel arrangements even though there was a 1-day train strike. A real plus was that every room comes with its own "computer" and WiFi. The system is really ingenious and was a huge help to us. We would definitely stay here again and gladly recommend it to friends

Reviews.Title: “lovely locanda!”
Reviews.Author: anna1devon
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful holiday in Vencie and part of the experience was this beautiful and stylish hotel. It's in a great location; very near to all the main sites but far enough away from the hustle and bustle of San Marco. The staff were helpful and put up with my useless knowldege of the Italian language. The beds were big and comfy too! I would love to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Typically venitian”
Reviews.Author: AFCDerby
Reviews.Content: Quaint little clean and tidy hotel in a very good location within walking distance of all the main sights. Very helpful staff who want your stay to be as enjoyable as possible. We had a Junior Suite which was a decent sized room with a beamed ceiling but not much else. If you want character and care more than facilities (no overhead shower, shower attachment on bath taps) then this may be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Location, great service, nice room and a bathroom that fit!”
Reviews.Author: JorgeCalgary
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in May 2010, the location is perfect for a tourist stay, close to everything and easy to access from the train station. The staff was more than helpful anytime we asked. The rooms are clean & ours on the top floor was wonderful, the bathroom is a good size.breakfast was nice each day and very personal service. Highly recommended! Stay here, you will be very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better hotel for this value!”
Reviews.Author: Pennsylvaniaben
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were both very satisfied with the hotel. The room was adequate in size, and the bathroom was very modern, even had a bidet! The breakfast was typical for a European Hotel, the brightspot was the espresso! The computer provided in the room was convenient, with a fast internet connection, and the best part about the hotel was the location. We could walk to both San Marco square and The Rialto Bridge in 10 minutes. The only thing we would recommend is to find a gondola ride on your own. Although it lasted an hour, and the prosecco was delicious, there wasn't much narration. If we could do it again, we would do it with music. Otherwise, Locanda Art Deco is definitely where we will stay on our next visit to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location and a charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: TAF8
Reviews.Content: We booked the 'economic honey moon room' but were upgraded to the 'junior suite' upon arrival. This was a lovely large airy room at the rear of the hotel . The only small criticism we have is that this room was next to the breakfast room and kitchen so there was a small amount of noise on a morning. Other than that, extremely comfortable beds with extra pillows (a rarity in our experience), helpful friendly staff and an excellent location. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Look Now, but there is a dvd player in the room!”
Reviews.Author: messagero
Reviews.Content: I loved the DVD collection of films made in or about Venice, that were on offer in the reception of the Locanda Art Deco. What a perfect way to pass a rainy afternoon in my cozy room. I have stayed here before and there is always another little detail of improvement. Now flat sceen tvs and dvd library! Great. Also the airport water bus -orange line ACTV -goes direcly to St `Angelo, one of the 3 convenient vaporetto stops for this place. How easy is that?

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it”
Reviews.Author: cheerfulcritic
Reviews.Content: I would avoid this hotel if possible. The one bright spot was Paula for her great customer service. The remainder of the staff was indolent, unfriendly, and could not care less. Beware of the off site location -- it's a cheap apartment designed for those with repelling skills from the bed: The bed, and the bed alone, is positioned at the top of a lost accessed by a steep staircase. If a trip to the bathroom is needed in midst of night, well, make sure you are very awake!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Beauty”
Reviews.Author: honeymooners160110
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for our Honeymoon in April. Andrea at reception was very helpful with lots of information and local knowledge. Breakfast is served from 8am to 9.30am. There are only 10 rooms in this 3 level building so it is very quiet. We stayed on the 2nd floor and had a view over the little alley way. It is 10 meters from a busy square with lots of restaurants. Right opposite the front door is a little shop with wine and food. It is a 5 minute walk to either the Rialto bridge or St Mark's Square, or 2 minutes to the Accademia Bridge. There is a computer with internet free of charge in each room so that was nice. The hotel has links with the only lady Gondolier in Venice so we used her to take us for a gondola ride. She charges 10 Euros more but goes for a full 1 hour ride whereas the men who stand by the bridges only go for 35 minutes. Plus she provides a bottle of local sparkling wine and we took our own punnet of strawberries for our ride. All the furniture in the room was very ornate and matched the decor of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, superclean, great location, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mavisbank
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in the Residence at the Locanda Art Deco (i.e. not the actual hotel itself - apartments/suites a 30 sec stroll away from the hotel). It's very near San Angelo vaporetti stop (2-3 min walk) and also San Samuele. Venice seemed tiny to us, the map looked big, but we got around in no time so I think most locations are great, but this was ideal for us. Quiet at night for sleeping, little shops etc around the corner to pick up some groceries, and a couple of nice little bars for a spritz. Everything else is only a vaporetto or walk away anyway. We stayed 3 nights in Loft 4, but on the morning after our first night the heating broke. My only complaint about our whole stay was that the night concierge who handled our first night of cold was rather blustery and unhelpful. He did get us a little gas heater very quickly, and that helped overnight the two nights we waited for an engineer (first night a Sunday, then a Monday a Venetian holiday), but it wasn't without a lot of huffing and puffing! However, we didn't see him again, and found the rest of the staff very welcoming and helpful, and we were delighted with the service overall. Their email comms are great - always almost instantaneous replies. When they realised the heating problem was complicated, they moved us to Loft 2 and we spent 4 nights there. The two rooms are very comparable. Both have a TV, digibox, even a little computer in each. The two ring hob and decent sized fridge were ideal for a couple of nights in. The rooms are immaculately clean, they look freshly furnished but not ikea. Loft 2 has a proper shower cabinet, Loft 4 only a shower in the bath so you have to sit down which is a bit of a faff. We didn't take breakfast so no comment to make on that. Great place, I'm sure you wouldn't be disappointed at all. Really great value in a city as expensive as Venice. Two great finds in Venice for us were 'La Cantina', Campo San Felice, Cannaregio, and 'Alla Bifora', Campo Santa Margherita, Dorsoduro. La Cantina for the fab staff who really know their wine, and their absolutely delicious fish plate (25 Euros pp, but we ate dreadful food elsewhere for the same price or more, more than once!), and Alla Bifora for candlelit atmosphere, lovely mixed meat and cheese plates, and great spritzes. We popped in for a quick drink in each place, and lost an evening in each because they were too lovely to leave!

Reviews.Title: “The exellent variant for budget staying in venice”
Reviews.Author: melifara
Reviews.Content: Really very nice, comfortable and charming hotel. Helpfull staff and rather tasty breakfasts, PC in rooms, perfect location - do you really want more?!

Reviews.Title: “charming, well located hotel with local venice flavor”
Reviews.Author: bellaliza
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a very romantic top-floor room with a wooden-beamed sloped ceiling and small windows that looked onto the nearby rooftops. the computer included in the room was a real convenience - just ask for the keyboard at check-in. the computer and room renovations were quite impressive juxtaposed against the beautiful 17th century (?) building frame. the breakfast was lovely with delicious freshly brewed coffee or cappuccinos upon request, but the seating space is limited so you may have to wait for a spot. the restaurant and bar downstairs are great hangouts and the location couldn't be better - set on a quiet side street but very nearby a water bus and a pleasant 15 minute stroll to piazza san marco. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: global_food
Reviews.Content: This cute, independent hotel is a on a side street in the San Marco Region of the city. The rooms are clean and comfortable with all needed amenities. When closed, the windows block out all city noises. Breakfast is included. The staff is extremely helpful. Francesca offered to make dinner reservations for us and when our first choices were closed, she recommended a place and even walked us there on her way home. Excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem in the heart of venice”
Reviews.Author: CastleClaire
Reviews.Content: This is a small, independent hotel. The rooms are simple but very clean with a great shower.I expected tea & coffee-making facilities in our room, but the hotel sets out the stuff you need in a communal area, so it never runs out (but you need to buy your milk from the little shop next door). The location, just off Campo San Stephano, is ideal, just 10 minutes' walk to San Marco or Rialto and 5 mins to Accademia. THe staff were really friendly and helpful too, so overall, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel, great staff, relatively reasonable”
Reviews.Author: wjbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed a total of 6 nights--3 different rooms. Very competant, courteous and helpful staff. Good location--15 minute walk to Piazza St. Marco and easy to reach from the Vaperetto stops. Some rooms are a bit small and quirky (one with a low, sloping cieling) but all were clean and quiet. Do use them to set up a gondola ride int he PM. They make it easy and really convenient. Good people at a good place. Walter

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel-Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Rothaiocht
Reviews.Content: We stayed in apartment 4 around the corner from the hotel. It was absolutely lovely. We had a beautiful living area with long windows which were a pleasure to look out of in the mornings, a huge bathroom and a sort of loft bedroom with painted wood beams. We also had a fridge. Breakfast was brought to our apartment when we rang for it (before 10) ,I could have moved in. The staff were so friendly, all smiles. It was situated on a lovely little street just off a lovely relaxed square. The location was fantastic, near everywhere. Venice of course was absolutely stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely well located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SpoonsGalway
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the sperate aparment from the hotel which was spacious. Very hot and air con wasn't fully working. Very Clean. Had a fridge. Didn't have internet as promised. Had wifi but not a computer in the room as other rooms seemed to have. Met three staff while on 2 day stay and one was very unhelpful and couldn't be bothered with us and unforturnately she was on most as she was on reception during the day. The guy on at night and lady in the early morning were very helpful. We weren't impressed with the gondala ride with Alex. She only spoke to us once to point out the opera house and that was it for the 50 min ride. She couldn't wait to get us off. Like she was in a hurry some where. After reading other praising reviews of her trip I was very dissapointed. Over all it was a great stay as location wins through. Pity about that grumpy staff member and Alex's lack of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: GRandPD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights, and everything was great! The room was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. Most of all we loved the location! When you step out from the hotel, there is a small grocery shop next door. There are cafes, restaurants, and a gelato shop. Speaking of location, the hotel was very convenient to go to St Marco, Rialto bridge, and Academia bridge. If you use the San Samuelle vapoletto station, there is no bridge to cross! Since bridges in Venice have stairs, so not having one bridge really eased our trip to the hotel. We stayed there two different times, and first time was all the way up at the attic. We have to be honst, it was not easy to climb up with two suitcases for us. We really wished that there was a lift. Also, wifi was weak., so we couldn't use much. When we stayed in there for the second time, it was on the lower floor, so we didn't suffer lifting our luggage, and the wifi was great! We felt rooms were a little small for both times. We will definitely go back there when we go back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Computer with internet in our room! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: rubidoe
Reviews.Content: Locanda Art Deco is a very small boutique hotel. The receptionist was very friendly and showed us to our room, M2, 3rd floor at the very top. There was no elevator, so walking up 3 flights with 3 suitcases was not very fun. Especially because it was very hot that day. But the receptionist opened our door to our room with air conditioning. It was very spacious with wood beams that gave it a very romantic feel. The best part was we had a computer with free internet. This was very nice after being on vacation for 3 weeks, and not being able to communicate with the world. I have never been at a hotel that actually had a computer in the room! Great ammenity!! We loved the service we received at Art Deco. They always pointed us in the right direction, and gave us excellent recommendations. The hotel is dead center between the Rialto Bridge and St. Marco Square. There is also a great bakery around the corner that had the best Zietti Cookies!

Reviews.Title: “A good value.”
Reviews.Author: embudo
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation online for their Surprise Room special for 90 euro, breakfast included, and stayed one night. We stayed in a sort of guest house a block away from their main building. Bottom line, this was a pleasant night's stay for a reasonable price, something not easy to find in Venice, and I'd recommend it. Clean, quiet, spacious room, comfortable bed (two twins pushed together, but comfortable still), with a/c and a modern TV. Breakfast was above average. It would have been comfortable for a longer stay, as the guest house had a nice shared kitchen. Their website is very clear that their Surprise Room is not refundable. Two nights before our reserved night, we realized we needed to change our plans and come later in our trip instead. We emailed to ask if we could do that. "Sorry, no," would have been a reasonable response under the circumstances, but they replied that it was no problem. There was some confusion about it thereafter, which was not handled with consummate professionalism by the person at the desk when we checked out, but after we had returned to the U.S. we got a very gracious email from the manager, Judith Boulbain, apologizing for the confusion and setting everything right. In the end, we certainly appreciated their flexibility. Venice is not the city of amazing deals, but Locanda Art Deco was a nice value.

Reviews.Title: “Great first visit to venice, hotel was great all around”
Reviews.Author: travel_junkieGR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at art deco june 30th - july 3rd. Staff were amazing, very helpfull and polite. Lots of tours were offered, all sounded great but the one i suggest you take is the gondola ride. we shopped around for prices and found the hotel's offer to be the best. 1 hour ride with champagne bottle and the first female gondolier. Location is great for proximity to st. mark's, riolta bridge, and academia bridge. It is busy but it's not drowning from tourist traffic like other hotel locations. Restaurants and ice cream shops are just around the corner. Breakfast was plain but good, no elevators but the majority of hotels around venice don't have anyways, no safe but we used the closet and took the key with us, it was very nice that they looked after our bags after checking out so we can finish last minute shopping. Some advice for first time visitors: Pack very light, buy water far from st. mark's and refill it at the fountains around venice, map is a must and even then you will still get lost, the further north you go the cheaper everything costs, and learn some basic italian. ciao

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: SvetlanaBoo
Reviews.Content: beautiful little hotel, good service, friendly staff, very clean, cosy, comfortable, romantic, internet, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Alab_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in their new apartment-style property in the street right next to their main hotel property. They had just bought this property, so we got a good deal by Venetian standards for our duplex suite. Breakfast is served in the suite at no extra charge, since they don't have a restaurant in this property, so that is another big plus especially if you don't fancy running into a lot of other grumpy morning faces. Nice restaurants in and off the piazza, and barely a few minutes walk to the boat-stop. All in all very practical and comfortable if you don't mind the functional decor in the public areas.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly and charming place to stay in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Fudge03
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel, on both occasions for work, two years apart. I loved it the first time, and this time it was even improved by the addition of wifi access and the loan of keyboards for the rooms. It's fantastically located very near to the Academia. It's clean, well maintained, and friendly. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and tremendous value--wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Pacdan
Reviews.Content: Venice is a difficult place to get a good hotel room at a modest rate. Locanda Art Deco solves the problem. Given the price of hotel rooms in Venice, this Locanda is a greater value that the rating suggests. And given the way way hotels and locanda are packed into Venice, this is a good compromise between price and amenities. Great location, one square away from San Marco, near the San Sammuele "vaporetti" (water bus). Our room was on the top floor (3rd floor, no lift) and was clean, comfortable though part of the room was cut by the pitch of the roof. The breakfast was generous. The staff was very helpful and cooperative. The street was full of wine bars and restaurants and shops. For anyone with mobility problems, this would not be the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: pradipd25
Reviews.Content: We were given a room in their Residence nearby. It consisted of 2 bed rooms, and a common living room with a small kitchenette. Our bedroom wa son the upper floor, with a bathroom outside. It was private, but not ensuite. The other bedroom had an ensuite bathroom. Out of the 4 nites, we were there, we were on our own in the entire apartment for 3 nites. Hence, we were able to spread out. This was particularly helpful for using my laptop, since there was no signal in the bedroom, and I was able to surf easily down in the living room. The room itself was a fair sized room, but the bathroom was tiny. I could barely sit on the WC, or stand in the shower. But everything was spotless and well maintained. There was an overall feeling of good taste. The a/c worked very well and was a blessing in the hot humid weather of Venice. Paula, one of the front office girls was extremely helpful with whatever information required. The only downside is the breakfast. It is very frugal, and almost stale to thepoint of being inedible. For the Residence, it is brought to the apartment in a tray. After the first morning, we would buy our own fruits, yogurt, juice etc and keep it in the fridge. Location was wonderful. Right in the middle of everything, yet tucked away in an alley and very quiet. Overall, it was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip”
Reviews.Author: fabetgaelle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a fantastic stay at Locanda Art Deco. Quality of service was only matched with the amazing interior design. We had the most delicious week end in the most romantic city in the world. It was awesome!! Thanks to the Locanda team for his kindness and diligence. Fab & Gaelle

Reviews.Title: “All wonderful...location, rooms, and staff!!”
Reviews.Author: desertmap
Reviews.Content: We had 3 lovely nights at Locanda. Located off the quiet Campo Santo Stefano, but close to San Marco, Rialto bridge and Accademia bridge. Very comfortable, clean rooms. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. Also, don't miss booking a gondola ride with Alexandra Hai...a wonderfully unique experience!!

Reviews.Title: “dont miss this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelguruWorlwide
Reviews.Content: there are many places in venice. -the very expensive -the very crappy that pretend to have 5 stars and this one, which is a real gem in the heart of it all. great value, great and attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely manager/concierge and great buy!”
Reviews.Author: ceegeeNjUsa
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent (walking distance to everywhere especially the vaporetto). The manager, Judith, was very gracious and informative ( in several languages). The room was very clean and the bathroom modern. Breakfast (included) was quite good considering the very reasonable cost of the room.

Reviews.Title: “lucky find”
Reviews.Author: vanessabLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: great little place in the center of it all. perhaps one of the cutest place in venice with full amenities and comfort. and at great value. would not hesitate to go back and have already recommended many times to my friends and colleagues!.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: HYT
Reviews.Content: I won't consider staying anywhere else the next time I'm in Venice. We stayed in Apartment #5, which was luxurious and, like the main Locanda Art Deco hotel, located just off the lovely St Stefano square. The S Angelo pier is extremely handy for getting to and from the airport too. The staff were all wonderful, and the gondola tour well worth the E90!

Reviews.Title: “Nice simple rooms in great location”
Reviews.Author: ramospinto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in March 2009 and had a great time. The rooms were spotlessly clean with crisp white linen, wrought iron bedstead and art deco and art nouveau furnishings. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Great value for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: JEM11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights earlier this month. It is in a fantastic location within walking distance of all the sights and plenty of lovely restaurants. We booked one of the 'lottery' rooms for a cut price and ended up with the very comfortable #101. The continental breakfast is served in a small area but it's filling and you're not sat there long so who cares! The staff were friendly and helped us with booking restaurants etc. We'd certainly stay there again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain hotel”
Reviews.Author: kombucha
Reviews.Content: Great bargain hotel very close to Piazza San Marco. Very clean. Very friendly staff. Very safe. Includes continental breakfast but there is a market next door where you can buy fruit, deli meat, salad and yogurt. We stayed on the top floor which was the most quiet - although the top floor is under the slanted roof so you need to bend over on one side of the room to avoid bumping the ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: brufig
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when the reservation we made with Locanda Salieri couldn't be guaranteed for the first two days. The hotel is very small and nicely decorated. The rooms are tiny but nicely decorated and the staff is helpful enough. They offer free Wi-Fi but it seems like they only have one access point as I could barely catch a signal. It's nicely located next to the Accademia and lots of restaurants and coffee shops. All of Venice seems pretty safe during the day but at night looks a bit deserted.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay At Locanda Art Deco!”
Reviews.Author: ChristiannaLondon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had two nights in Venice in early July and loved every aspect of our stay at Locanda Art Deco. It was in a fantastic location, the room was exactly as pictured and the staff were cheery and hospitable. The hotel had a unique style with many beautiful antiques and interesting pieces of furniture etc. and it was very reasonably priced. We arrived early on the day but were shown to our rooms with no problems at all. We loved the wooden beams on the ceiling and enjoyed staying somewhere that was not a clinical hotel room. The room had been renovated recently and included all required amenities plus some extras (tv). The location was very handy being right beside the piazza which had excellent restaurants. Also there was a food store and gelateria right beside the hotel. Very handy!! Breakfast was included - cereal, crossaints, fresh breadrolls and spreads were provided, along with tea and coffee. We loved our stay at Locanda Art Deco and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone. After we had left we realised we had left our mobile phone in the room. By the time we had realised the hotel had already contacted us via email requesting a postal address to foward the phone onto. They sent it off immediately and could not have been more helpful. Nothing was too much trouble and we could not have been more relieved or thankful! A very memorable stay! We will be back again!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Apartment #2”
Reviews.Author: guzadog
Reviews.Content: We would stay at the Locanda Art Deco hotel again. We stayed for three nights in one of their apartments (they are located 50 metres from the main hotel). The apartment had a loft with a king sized bed in it and a large sitting area with a couch (that could convert into a bed). The bathroom had all the usual things including a bidet. There was also a small kitchenette (no oven but two pot hot plate) and a small fridge. Our only reason we didn't rate it "excellent" was that they were still putting some finishing touches on the studio so it was still a bit of a work in progress. We would highly recommend booking a gondola ride through the hotel with Alex Hai. She was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kildareash
Reviews.Content: We arrived at approx 11pm on the Monday night. We got off at the Accademia stop and it is literally a straight walk into campo san stefano and Art Deco is located just off the square. When we arrived there a man was standing outside the hotel and for a minute I didn't think he was going to let us in. He wasn't rude but he wasn't exactly friendly or welcoming! Anyway, we got the key and hauled our bag up the two flights of stairs to our room. The room was a really good size, as was the bed. It was immacualtely clean, as was the en suite. Breakfast wasn't exactly fulfilling. But it was fine, just bread rolls. There was cereal available but i didn't like the taste of it (this is more my fault than the hotel's fault tho!) Location wise, i couldn't believe how close by everything was. On the map it looked like everything was miles away but on the first day, we just went strolling around and within a few minutes, found ourselves at Rialto bridge! The only negative comment I can have about the hotel is the staff. Although they weren't rude, they weren't helpful either. Would barely greet you when you came in or were leaving. However the 15% discount for paying in cash was an added bonus! And I would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Art Deco Residence”
Reviews.Author: Voyageurcontent
Reviews.Content: We are a Canadian couple in our 60s; we stayed in a double room the first week of November 2007 for 670 euros, which included a one-hour gondola â€œtour of the hidden canals of Venice... by the unique Lady Gondolier of Veniceâ€�, with a bottle of Prosecco (when this was offered to us, we figured what the heck, letâ€™s be real tourists...! It turned out fine as we scheduled the ride in the early evening that turned out mild and clear. Lovely starlight.) Our room was not in the main building featured on the website, but in a second building around the corner. The location and room were great: clean, a good size (we were on the first floor), with a bathroom outside the room in a corridor separate from the stairway to the other rooms in the building. We were pleasantly surprised to find that the sitting/breakfast room on the first floor that is shared with the other rooms includes a two-burner stove top, fridge, sink and a full assortment of glasses, plates and cutlery - including a corkscrew. So we were able to shop in the Rialto market to cook suppers on nights we didnâ€™t go out to eat. The breakfasts were fine: coffee (either cappuccino or cafÃ¨ leche) with croissants or brioches, cheese, butter, jam. All the staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. We bought vaparetto weekâ€™s passes when we arrived; that paid for itself within a couple of days. The residence is a few minutesâ€™ stroll to the closest vaparetto, making it very convenient and easy to go anywhere fairly quickly. We were walking distance or vaparetto ride to everything that interested us. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend to anyone looking for a quiet convenient spot in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Just this side of quirky.”
Reviews.Author: gramachree
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room and charming staff. BMIbaby managed to lose my luggage, The hotel was as helpful as could be. We also liked the discount for cash. :-) The sole reservation, and not worthy of knocking down a star, was their recommendation of the restaurant opposite (under two metres door to door!) That restaurant was underwhelming, aloof and expensive. OTOH they had recommended Rosa Rossa (five minutes stroll towards Tialto) as cheep and cheerful. Their spaghetti al'aglio, olio et peporincino was my favourite. So that balanced it out. BTW, their gondolier seems to be quite a find. But she doesn't "do" mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: 08Canucks
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to be hit or miss based on the other reviews, but we had no problems. Our room( junior suite for 3 people) had alot of character, the bathroom was clean, fully equipped, and newly tiled. The breakfast was standard continental and was included in the price. The staff was helpful and friendly. Above average for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the guest-shifting habit of this property”
Reviews.Author: Chandolin
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™re planning our sixth or seventh visit to Venice, and -- just for fun -- checked Trip Advisorâ€™s reviews of the Locanda Art Deco. I almost choked with laughter at the March 22 review, about shifting guests from place to place, and thought Iâ€™d contribute our experience in 2003. We had booked an apartment through the Locanda Art Decoâ€™s website, with many emails to Judith, who I assume is the owner or manager. When we arrived at the ferrovia, we called the Locanda, but the man who answered didnâ€™t know what we were talking about when we said that Luciano was supposed to meet us at the vaporetto stop. So we hopped on #82, got off at San Samuele, dragged our bags to the Locanda, and announced that we were booked to stay in an apartment. He had no record of our booking, so tried to call Judith, with whom I had been communicating, without success. Eventually he said that there had been a mistake, that we could stay at the Hotel Al Sole for one night and then get our apartment the next day. We had no choice, so he called a water taxi, walked us back to San Samuele, we rode in style to the rather crummy hotel, checked in, left our bags in our room with a bad bed, and set out to see the area where we were staying so we wouldnâ€™t have to return. We both complained to the desk clerk and I was really steaming. My husband told Reception that he wanted to talk to Judith, so after breakfast, he called her and she told my husband that the people in the apartment overstayed for one night and that we would be taken back to San Samuele in a water taxi, Luciano would meet us and take us to the apartment. He told her that she had really disappointed us, had made us waste time, and that we shouldnâ€™t pay full rate for the night in this awful hotel. We settled on a saving of â‚¬50. Packed up, water taxied back to San Samuele, and there was no one there. But in about 5 minutes, Luciano arrived, smiling, and told us that we would be staying at the Locanda instead, at the same price as the apartment, which was â‚¬30/night less. Walked to the Locanda, left the bags at the desk, and off we went. After a day of sightseeing, we returned to the Locanda. Our room was lovely, except for a squeaky bathroom door, just a hand shower in the tub, no CNN or other English channel, and an unlockable window that opened onto a roof or terrace that could have provided entry to someone. At breakfast one morning, we were alone with an American couple -- the couple who were sitting in the lobby with their bags when we returned to the Locanda for our first night here. I asked them whether their room had a hand shower like ours or a real shower. But they were in an apartment, although they had expected to be at the Locanda, and just having breakfasts there. We suddenly realized that the reason we were in the Locanda is that Judith must have decided to disappoint them instead of us, since we had made so much fuss, and they had been in the lobby waiting for someone to take them to the apartment. We asked them how they liked the apartment -- they said it was fine, except for the person above them who seemed to be practicing flamenco dancing. Did we luck out! And it looks like this is the normal procedure at the Locanda Art Deco. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel ... when you get your booked room”
Reviews.Author: CapercaillieMainz
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a perfect location BUT we still have a bad "aftertaste" because of one point. We booked our room for 4 nights over 6 month in advance directly in the hotel. I phoned them one week previous of our stay, everything seemed fine. As we arrived early in the afternoon they said that they are fully booked for this night and that we can't get our room. But we have the chance to stay in another hotel just two streets away and that we can get our booked room for the rest of our stay. As we asked if this other hotel is the same category as the Locanda Art Deco we get a dodgy answer. What would you have done in a foreign city? So we stayed in this other "hotel" that looked like that it need a renovation shortly. Our room however was lately renovated and clean. But it was very small so there was only room for a smaller bed and two nightstands. There was no cupboard, not even a chair for your clothing. No tv or telephone. In the night it get's quite chilly. The next day we got our booked normal double room in the Locanda Art Deco. That was quite a change. This room seemed to be one or two categories higher. It was much bigger, a bigger bed and a cupboard, chairs, tv and telephone (and it was warmer in the night). You may think this can happen from time to time on particular days ... but after 3(4) nights in the Locanda Art Deco we got the feeling that it was more of a normal procedure. Every morning there was another couple which looked like us after the first night (you don't get any breakfast in the other "hotel" so you have to take your coat and walk to the Locanda Art Deco. So you recognize these "special" guests quite quickly). Generally I would recommend the Locanda Art Deco. It is a nice hotel, an excellent location but I don't know in which way you could acquiring to get shurely this booked room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location, Cute B&B”
Reviews.Author: IAH_traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a cute, small hotel off a very nice square, Campo Santo Stefano. Very close to the Accademia bridge & convenient vaporetto stops, lots of cafes in the campo and it has a local feel which is nice. Internet cafe & pharmacy in the square as well. The hotel is immaculately clean. Cute Venetian details such as the wood-beamed ceilings in the rooms. Not a plush hotel, but it doesn't have a plush price either. Good value in pricey Venice. The simple continental breakfast is enough to give you the necessary caffeine jolt, and then you can grab a great "spremuta" or a capuccino later. Nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: lollopard
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel with a good location. It is easy to walk both to St Marks square and to the Rialto bridge. It is located close to a small square with restaurants and some bars. Unfortunately we got one of the attic rooms (very small with a vague moldy smell and just a tiny window). After one night and some negotiation we were allowed to make a switch to a bright and spacious room one floor down. This room was very satisfactory. The hotel serves breakfast (Standard italian with bread and jam), but after the first morning we choose to give it a miss and have breakfast at a very nice bar just outside the hotel were they served delicious pastry and fantastic coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: singrish
Reviews.Content: For venice, this hotel is nice because it has a very rustic deco. It is away from the main piazza thus provides an "escape-from-city-feeling" and those walking around each day. Nice bathroom. Keiran was the staff who helped us a lot, she was very hospitable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - pity about the room”
Reviews.Author: PHIL-DIBDIN
Reviews.Content: The Locanda art deco has good points and bad points. To summarise :- firstly the good - 1. Ideal location to visit and view all of Venice`s attractions. 2. Staff are friendly and helpful. 3. Everything is clean. 4. Breakfast is adequate. Now the bad :- 1. Try and avoid the room we were booked in - M2 and it`s sister room M1 - these are attic rooms with a sloping ceiling and to enter the bed on the restricted side it would be helpful if you were a dwarf - also if you were woken unexpectedly during the night you would jump up and bang your head on the over-hanging wooden beams - only about a half of the floor area is actually functional. 2. The bathroom has all facilities, however it is impossible to stand square on to the sink due to the positioning of the shower unit. 3. We were charged 155 euros per night but no price was displayed in the room. The bottom line is we would be reluctant to return here and only if we were assured of a different room

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: La10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in late July 06 during the recent heatwave. We booked thehotel because of the good location and air conditioning. The location was good, however on arrival we were told that the air conditioning did not seem to be working properly. This was something of an understatement. Although it would switch on it hardly gave out any cold air and the problem continued throughout our stay. We complained on a regular basis and were, for one, night provided with a fan! However on the second day the helpful man on reception came into 'fix' the air conditioning and took the fan away. We never saw the fan again and the air conditioning then didn't even switched on. The air conditioning problems continued throughout our stay and there was no serious attempt to fix the problem. It made our stay in Venice a lot less pleasant than we expected it to be. On an additional note the breakfast was nothing to write home about and if you can stay here on a room only basis you would be better off and grabbing a coffee and pastry from a near by bakery.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mellenbal
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, right near Accademia and 'just far enough' away from the tourist crowds. We had room M1, which was a very cute and quiet room on the top floor. The shower and pillows could have been a bit better -- pillows were quite flat and the shower: didn't drain well, leaked a bit on the floor and REALLY was in need of a little shelf. BUT truly, those few slightly negative things said -- we would definitely stay here again! The service was great, the room was clean, the price was great...and most importantly we really liked the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights and found the hotel to be welcoming, in a great location, and at a great price. Venice is generally overpriced, but this was not only a good deal, but a wonderful experience. The rooms are small, but clean and equipped with all the necessities. The staff was welcoming, helpful, and trustworthy. We would certainly stay there again and we recommend it to anyone going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Never got to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: hk1303
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location and looked small and cosy. However when we turned up just before the busy Easter weekend there was a 'problem' with our room and our reservation could not be guaranteed. We can only speculate as to if this was a double booking or not but there seemed to be plenty of other people staying there! Be warned..... The other hotel we stayed in turned out to be nicer and cheaper in the end!

Reviews.Title: “It's a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieLever
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights from 8th April. If you like small, quaint hotels this is definitely the place to stay in Venice. Great position, exceptionally clean rooms and the service was excellent. Giuseppe, the Sales Manager, on reception was always very helpful. We booked by email which was dealt with very efficiently. We took advantage of booking Alexandria from the hotel - the only female gondaliera in Venice. We went early evening at 7.30pm and it was the icing on top of the cake. We will certainly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: els37
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice, friendly establishment. Rooms were spacious and comfortable, (for the amount of time we spent in them anyway), bathroom was a decent size and both it & room were very clean.Air con was good & quiet which was handy cos a bit noisy ( not excessive though) to leave the windows open.Breakfast was adequate, nothing special.Usual continental fayre. Great location & had the vaporetto not been on strike on the day we arrived, which meant we had to lug our luggage from the Rialto bridge, which in 90 degree heat is no picnic, I would have no criticisms at all. Getting to the hotel absolutley shattered & boiling and finding no lift, which meant having to carry our own cases up all the stairs was not fun. Had we been able to get off at the Academia bridge this would not even be an issue. So I would say stay here it's a nice place but not if getting up & down stairs is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJFlint
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on Rick Steves' reccomendation and stayed there for 2 nights in January 2006. This hotel met our expectations. As everyone agrees, the location is superb, within a 2-minute walking distance of the vaporetto stop and very close to everything that Venice has to offer. The staff is nice and friendly (special thanks to Giuseppe who takes his job very seriously). The room (a double) was fairly small but clean. Basic breakfast, nothing to complain or brag about. All in all, we will definitely stay there on our next trip. For the sake of full disclosure, here are a few minor problems we encountered during our stay: (1) the boiler in our room was probably too small as we once ran out of hot water during the morning showers and (2) they forgot to give us clean towels but immediately complied with our request.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in room 100”
Reviews.Author: TVnMe
Reviews.Content: Ok this hotel was lovely, cute, nice breakfast area great area the nicest staff. But when we walked in our room all the loveliness went away. First thing the hotel staff member did was look under a rug that was nailed to the wall. When he left we looked at what he was looking at, there was a huge hole to the left of our bed that was filled with paint and plaster and all those sort of supplies. There was bug blood splatters all over the walls. The room had a smell to it, probley from the paint. And at the other end of the room there were three broken chairs stacked by the window. This room seemed more like a storage closet. Because the room smelled we had to keep the window open at night, and we got bite 6 times by mosiquitos. We looked in other rooms on the way to breakfast(the maid was cleaning and has the doors open) and they all looked lovely. So don't stay in room 100.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bnh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Locanda Art Deco in May 2005 for two nights. The location is fantastic, only 5-10 minutes walk from the Academica Bridge and about the same to St Mark's Square. Yes, the stairs to the rooms are steep but if you've already carried your luggage from the vaporetto and across the Academic Bridge, what's a few more steps? The secret is to travel light! Our room was a good size, clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was small but adequate and spotless. Breakfast was basic but adequate however the breakfast area is very small so you may need to wait for a table. Alternatively the cafe across the street is very good and reasonably priced. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the Locanda Art Deco. The staff was incredibly nice and the location was great. We did stay in the Honeymoon suite and thought it was nice- half of the room does slant so you do have to watch your head when on the far side of the bed. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stop!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mickgoodie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at Easter- April 05 Very good location - only 6-7 mins walk to St marks Sq and the same to the Rialto bridge. only a 3 min walk to the Academia vaporetto stop as well - so get off Here!!!! Hotel was nice and clean, frendly staff, the continental breakfast were basic but just what you needed in the morning. Everything was fresh and well stocked. We had the mini Suite room, bigger than the standard room clean and tidy and nice and quiet - as the room was located at the back of the hotel. All in all - good price, good location highly recommended!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Locanda Art Deco
HotelInfo.Address: 2966 Calle delle Botteghe | San Marco, 30124 Venice, Italy
